meanings.definition: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The obstinate child refused to eat his vegetables no matter what.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her obstinate refusal to compromise on important matters.
meanings.sent3: The obstinate cat insisted on sleeping in the same spot every night.
meanings.sent4: His obstinate belief in his own abilities led him to success against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The obstinate oak tree stood tall against the strong winds, never bending.

meanings.definition: Difficult to deal with, control, or get rid of.
meanings.sent1: The weeds in the garden were obstinate and kept growing back.
meanings.sent2: The old rusty lock was obstinate and wouldn't open no matter how hard he tried.
meanings.sent3: The obstinate stain on the carpet just wouldn't come out, no matter what she tried.
meanings.sent4: The obstinate computer virus proved to be a challenging foe for the IT team.
meanings.sent5: The obstinate knot in the rope refused to budge, causing frustration for the sailor.

meanings.definition: Showing a stubborn and determined attitude.
meanings.sent1: Despite the obstacles, she had an obstinate determination to reach her goals.
meanings.sent2: The obstinate expression on his face showed he was not going to back down.
meanings.sent3: The obstinate hiker insisted on reaching the mountain peak before sunset.
meanings.sent4: Her obstinate commitment to her principles earned her respect from others.
meanings.sent5: The obstinate ant continued to carry the heavy load, undeterred by its size.
